key_points: NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace believes Kyle Rittenhouse would have been treated more harshly if he were Black.
Rittenhouse was found not guilty on all charges related to killing two people and wounding another at Kenosha protests.
Rittenhouse claimed self-defense in the shooting, which occurred during protests over the police shooting of Jacob Blake.
Wallace's tweet suggests a racial bias in the trial outcome.
Rittenhouse's acquittal has further deepened the partisan divide in the country.
The parents of Anthony Huber, one of the victims, expressed no accountability is being taken for their son's death.
There are concerns about violent protests following the verdict.
Politicians and public figures are reacting to the verdict with varied opinions.
Some see the verdict as justice served, while others view it as a miscarriage of justice.
The case has sparked discussions about racial injustice and the legal system.
spokespersons: Karen Bloom and John Huber (Parents of Anthony Huber, victim)
